newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Sumitomo plans copper changes - Taiwan division.
newsitem.headline: Sumitomo plans copper changes - Taiwan division.

text.p: Japan's Sumitomo Corp has plans to restructure its Asian copper business, but its Taiwan copper division does not intend to cut back on its staff or operations, a Sumitomo official in Taipei said.
"Sumitomo has plans to restructure its copper business, but the Taiwan division will not be affected," the official said.
She declined to comment on the wider plans in detail, but confirmed that Sumitomo was likely to pull out of Thailand in the restructuring effort.
"Sumitomo may have to pull out of Thailand due to market size, cost and other considerations," she said.
Earlier on Tuesday the chief executive officer of Bangkok Cable Co. told Reuters in Tokyo that Sumitomo would not be supplying any copper cathodes to Thailand next year.
Taiwan industry sources said Sumitomo's reputation remained good in the country and the company continued to maintain a key role in the island's copper market.
"Sumitomo is a highly reputable company here," a Minchali Metal executive said, adding that Sumitomo was a major if not the largest supplier in Taiwan.
The executive declined to estimate Sumitomo's market share.
Taiwan is on track to import about 500,000 tonnes of copper in 1996.
